enums.name: NI.Line.Direction
enums.description-en: Enumerated values for the direction and output topology of a DIO line

values.name: Input
values.description-en: Route line from the front I/O connector to the rear I/O connector

values.name: Output_Source
values.description-en: Route line from the rear I/O connector to the front I/O connector with sourcing output topology

values.name: Output_Sink
values.description-en: Route line from the rear I/O connector to the front I/O connector with sinking output topology

values.name: Output_PushPull
values.description-en: Route line from the rear I/O connector to the front I/O connector with push-pull output topology

enums.name: NI.VsupSource
enums.description-en: Enumerated values for the selection of the bank's voltage source

properties.name: NI.ModuleControllerVersion
properties.documentation-en: The version is the timestamp, in hexadecimal format, of the time the Module Controller firmware was compiled.

properties.name: NI.RearBufferState
properties.description-en: Logic states of all rear I/O connector input buffers
properties.documentation-en: Reading this property retrieves the current logic states of the rear I/O connector input buffers. This retrieval is software controlled, so the actual sampling time of the inputs is not deterministic. The lines are simultaneously sampled in hardware. The value at each bit position is a function of the logic state at the XJ2 pin and the corresponding line's direction and enable configuration. An enabled line configured as an input will drive the rear I/O connector input buffer to the same state as detected at the front I/O connector input buffer. Each bit of this UInt32 corresponds to the state of an I/O line. Use the NI.Line.Index property of an I/O line to determine its bit location in the UInt32.

properties.name: NI.FrontBufferState
properties.description-en: Logic states of all front I/O connector input buffers
properties.documentation-en: Reading this property retrieves the current logic states of the front I/O connector input buffers. This retrieval is software controlled, so the actual sampling time of the inputs is not deterministic. The lines are simultaneously sampled in hardware. The value at each bit position is a function of the voltage at the module DSUB pin and the bank range and threshold configuration. An enabled line configured as an output may drive the front I/O connector input buffer to a specific voltage, depending on the bank supply voltage configuration, the line's output topology, and the line's logic state from the rear I/O connector input buffer. Each bit of this UInt32 corresponds to the state of an I/O line. Use the NI.Line.Index property of an I/O line to determine its bit location in the UInt32.

properties.name: NI.StatusAllInitConfigWritten
properties.description-en: State of the "initialValue" write detection state machine
properties.documentation-en: To support "initialValue" fields in the Capabilities JSON, the module automatically updates its configuration after the necessary registers have been written with the values. This property is set to true once those writes have completed. If this property is false after resetting the module, then the Capabilities JSON may be incomplete or an error in SLSC software may have occurred.

properties.name: NI.StatusVsup_1PowerFailed
properties.description-en: State of the latched failure status of the module's Vsup_1 rail from the rear I/O connector
properties.documentation-en: When the NI.StatusVsup_1PowerGood property changes from true to false, this property latches true until it is reset by the NI.Status24V_FaultAcknowledge command when NI.StatusVsup_1PowerGood is true. If this property is true, then the supply voltage selection for any bank set to Vsup_1 has been forced off for a nonzero duration.

properties.name: NI.StatusVsup_1PowerGood
properties.description-en: State of the Vsup_1 rail on the module from the rear I/O connector
properties.documentation-en: When the Vsup_1 rail from the rear I/O connector is below the safe operating range for the module, this property is set to false. Simultaneously, to protect the module's output circuitry, the supply voltage selection for any bank set to Vsup_1 is forced off until the Vsup_1 rail recovers and is stable.

properties.name: NI.StatusVsup_0PowerFailed
properties.description-en: State of the latched failure status of the module's Vsup_0 rail from the rear I/O connector
properties.documentation-en: When the NI.StatusVsup_0PowerGood property changes from true to false, this property latches true until it is reset by the NI.AcknowledgeVsupPowerFailed command when NI.StatusVsup_0PowerGood is true. If this property is true, then the supply voltage selection for any bank set to Vsup_0 has been forced off for a nonzero duration.

properties.name: NI.StatusVsup_0PowerGood
properties.description-en: State of the Vsup_0 rail on the module from the rear I/O connector
properties.documentation-en: When the Vsup_0 rail from the rear I/O connector is below the safe operating range for the module, this property is set to false. Simultaneously, to protect the module's output circuitry, the supply voltage selection for any bank set to Vsup_0 is forced off until the Vsup_0 rail recovers and is stable.

properties.name: NI.Status24VPowerFailed
properties.description-en: State of the latched failure status of the module's 24 V rail from the SLSC Interface
properties.documentation-en: When the NI.Status24VPowerGood property becomes false, this property latches as true until it is reset by the NI.Acknowledge24VPowerFailed command after NI.Status24V_PowerGood returns to true. If this property is true, then the supply voltage selection for both banks of the module has been forced off for a nonzero duration.

properties.name: NI.Status24VPowerGood
properties.description-en: State of the 24 V rail on the module from the SLSC Interface
properties.documentation-en: When the 24 V rail from the SLSC Interface is below the safe operating range for the module, this property is set to false. Simultaneously, to protect the module's output circuitry and to prevent the module front I/O connector outputs from glitching high, the supply voltage selection for both banks is forced off until the 24 V rail recovers and is stable.

properties.name: NI.Status3_3VPowerGood
properties.description-en: State of the 3.3 V rail from the SLSC Interface on the module
properties.documentation-en: This property will always be true on a correctly functioning module because the Module Controller requires the 3.3 V rail from the SLSC Interface to operate.

properties.name: NI.TestModeEnable
properties.documentation-en: Enable state for the module's Test Mode. When Test Mode is enabled, the module will output the values from the NI.TestModeValue property on the corresponding lines. Each line's respective direction and enable configuration will still apply when Test Mode is active. The data source of the lines is the only change when Test Mode is active. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.TestModeUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.TestModeValue
properties.description-en: Output logic states for all I/O lines when Test Mode is enabled
properties.documentation-en: Output logic states for all I/O lines of the module for use during Test Mode. The logic state corresponding to each line may be set independently of the other states. Each bit of this UInt32 corresponds to the state of an I/O line. Use the NI.Line.Index property of an I/O line to determine its bit location in the UInt32. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.TestModeUpdate command.

commands.name: NI.UpdateChannelConfiguration
commands.description-en: Command to complete updating physical channel properties
commands.documentation-en: This command enables simultaneous updating of the functional state of the module's physical channel configuration. Simultaneous updating of the physical channels' properties prevents the register write commit order from creating unexpected channel configuration states. Run this command to make changes to physical channels' properties take effect.

commands.name: NI.UpdateTestMode
commands.description-en: Command to complete updating Test Mode properties
commands.documentation-en: This command enable simultaneous updating of the functional state of the module's Test Mode configuration. Run this command to make changes to Test Mode properties take effect.

commands.name: NI.Acknowledge24VPowerFailed
commands.description-en: Command to acknowledge a latched 24 V power failure status
commands.documentation-en: This command resets the NI.Acknowledge24VPowerFailed property to false when previously latched true due to a 24 V power failure. This command will have no effect on the latched state of NI.Status24VPowerFailed if the NI.Status24V_PowerGood property is still false.

commands.name: NI.AcknowledgeVsupPowerFailed
commands.description-en: Command to acknowledge latched Vsup power failure status(es)
commands.documentation-en: This command resets both the NI.StatusVsup_0PowerFailed and NI.StatusVsup_1PowerFailed properties to false when previously latched true due to Vsup_0 or Vsup_1 power failures, respectively. This command will have no effect on the latched state of NI.StatusVsup_0PowerFailed if the NI.StatusVsup_0PowerFailed is still false. This command will have no effect on the latched state of NI.StatusVsup_1PowerFailed if the NI.StatusVsup_1PowerFailed is still false.

scales.name: InputThreshold33V_Scale
scales.description-en: Scales a given voltage into the 10-bit threshold value for the 33 V input range

scales.name: InputThreshold5V_Scale
scales.description-en: Scales a given voltage into the 10-bit threshold value for the 5 V input range

physicalChannels.name: bank0
physicalChannels.description-en: Bank of digital input/output lines on connector J1

properties.name: NI.VsupSelect
properties.documentation-en: Voltage source selection for this bank. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.PullupEnable
properties.documentation-en: Enable for this bank's front I/O connector pullup resistors. When enabled, this bank connects the pullup resistors to the supply chosen in NI.VsupSelect. When disabled, this bank disconnects the pullup resistors from the supply. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.RangeEnable5V
properties.documentation-en: Enable for this bank's voltage range. When enabled, this bank uses the NI.InputThreshold5V for the input threshold. When disabled, this bank uses the NI.InputThreshold33V for the input threshold. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.InputThreshold5V
properties.description-en: Input threshold voltage for the 5 V range
properties.documentation-en: Input threshold voltage for this bank when its NI.RangeEnable5V is true. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.InputThreshold33V
properties.description-en: Input threshold voltage for the 33 V range
properties.documentation-en: Input threshold voltage for this bank when its NI.RangeEnable5V is false. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

physicalChannels.name: bank1
physicalChannels.description-en: Bank of digital input/output lines on connector J2

properties.name: NI.VsupSelect
properties.documentation-en: Voltage source selection for this bank. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.PullupEnable
properties.documentation-en: Enable for this bank's front I/O connector pullup resistors. When enabled, this bank connects the pullup resistors to the supply chosen in NI.VsupSelect. When disabled, this bank disconnects the pullup resistors from the supply. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.RangeEnable5V
properties.documentation-en: Enable for this bank's voltage range. When enabled, this bank uses the NI.InputThreshold5V for the input threshold. When disabled, this bank uses the NI.InputThreshold33V for the input threshold. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.InputThreshold5V
properties.description-en: Input threshold voltage for the 5 V range
properties.documentation-en: Input threshold voltage for this bank when its NI.RangeEnable5V is true. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.InputThreshold33V
properties.description-en: Input threshold voltage for the 33 V range
properties.documentation-en: Input threshold voltage for this bank when its NI.RangeEnable5V is false. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

physicalChannels.name: port0/line0
physicalChannels.description-en: Configurable digital input/output line with index 0 in bank0.

properties.name: NI.Line.Index
properties.description-en: Overall index of this DIO line in the module
properties.documentation-en: This is the index of this DIO line for the aggregate module properties: NI.FrontBufferState, NI.RearBufferState, and NI.TestModeValue.

properties.name: NI.Line.Direction
properties.documentation-en: Line signal flow direction through the module, relative to the front I/O connector. This property is only used when the NI.ChannelEnable for this line is set to true. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.name: NI.Line.Enable
properties.documentation-en: DIO output enable for one line. When this property is set to true, the input and output buffers for the front I/O connector and the rear I/O connector of the line are configured using the NI.Line.Direction property. When this property is set to false, the buffers for both the front I/O connector and the rear I/O connector are configured as inputs. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

properties.documentation-en: DIO output enable for one line. When this property is set to true, the input and output buffers for the front I/O connector and the rear I/O connector of the line are configured using the NI.Line.Direction property. When this property is set to false, the buffers for both the front I/O connector and the rear I/O connector are configured as inputs. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

physicalChannels.name: port2/line1
physicalChannels.description-en: Configurable digital input/output line with index 17 in bank1.

properties.name: NI.Line.Index
properties.description-en: Overall index of this DIO line in the module
properties.documentation-en: This is the index of this DIO line for the aggregate module properties: NI.FrontBufferState, NI.RearBufferState, and NI.TestModeValue.

properties.name: NI.Line.Direction
properties.documentation-en: Line signal flow direction through the module, relative to the front I/O connector. This property is only used when the NI.ChannelEnable for this line is set to true. Changes to this property take effect after running the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command.

registers.name: RearIOConnectorChannelStateReg
registers.description-en: Register for the rear I/O connector channel state

bitfields.name: ChannelState
bitfields.description-en: Logic state of all rear I/O connector input buffers

registers.name: FrontIOConnectorChannelStateReg
registers.description-en: Register for the front I/O connector channel state

bitfields.name: ChannelState
bitfields.description-en: Logic state of all front I/O connector input buffers

registers.name: ModuleStatusReg
registers.description-en: Register for monitoring board-level module status

bitfields.name: Status3_3V_PowerGood
bitfields.description-en: 3.3 V power status (always '1' on successful module access)

bitfields.name: Status24V_PowerFailed
bitfields.description-en: Latching status indicating 24 V power failure

bitfields.name: Vsup0_PowerFailed
bitfields.description-en: Latching status indicating Vsup_0 power failure

bitfields.name: Vsup1_PowerFailed
bitfields.description-en: Latching status indicating Vsup_1 power failure

bitfields.name: ConfigurationUpdatesDone
bitfields.description-en: Status indicating that the command controlled by ConfigCommandReg/ChannelConfigurationUpdate is done

bitfields.name: AllInitConfigWritten
bitfields.description-en: Status indicating that the initial configuration writes from the "initialValue" fields of the Capabilities JSON have completed

bitfields.name: Status24V_PowerFailedAck
bitfields.description-en: Target bitfield for the NI.Acknowledge24VPowerFailed command

bitfields.name: VsupPowerFailedAck
bitfields.description-en: Target bitfield for the NI.AcknowledgeVsupPowerFailed command

registers.name: ChannelDirectionReg
registers.description-en: Register for setting channel direction (This register requires having a valid "initialValue" set.)

registers.name: ChannelEnableReg
registers.description-en: Register for setting channel enable (This register requires having a valid "initialValue" set.)

registers.name: BankConfigurationReg
registers.description-en: Register for configuring bank settings (This register requires having a valid "initialValue" set.)

registers.name: TestModeEnableReg
registers.description-en: Register for setting Test Mode enable (This register requires having a valid "initialValue" set.)

registers.name: TestModeValueReg
registers.description-en: Register for setting Test Mode value (This register requires having a valid "initialValue" set.)

bitfields.name: ChannelConfigurationUpdate
bitfields.description-en: Target bitfield for the NI.ChannelConfigurationUpdate command

bitfields.name: TestModeUpdate
bitfields.description-en: Target bitfield for the NI.TestModeUpdate command

registers.name: ReservedConfigReg
registers.description-en: Reserved configuration register. Do not modify the value stored in this register. Do not set an "initialValue" on this register.

registers.name: ReservedConfig2Reg
registers.description-en: Reserved configuration register. Do not modify the value stored in this register. Do not set an "initialValue" on this register.

registers.name: ComplianceTestReg
registers.description-en: SLSC Predefined Register: Compliance Test Register

registers.name: ComplianceTestPatternReg
registers.description-en: SLSC Predefined Register: Compliance Test Pattern Register
